loot_tables.description: Block loot tables extracted from data/minecraft/loot_table/blocks/
files: loot_tables.json - Full loot table JSON data for each block
biomes.json - List of all biome resource IDs

damage_types.description: Damage type entries extracted from data/minecraft/damage_type/
files: damage_types.json - List of all damage type resource IDs

block_tags.description: Block tags extracted from data/minecraft/tags/block/, including mineable tags
files: block_tags.json - All block tags with their associated blocks
mineable_tags.json - Mineable tags indicating which tools can mine which blocks
block_tags.usage: Mineable tags are essential for block breaking - they indicate which tools (pickaxe, shovel, axe, hoe) can efficiently mine which blocks

tool_speeds.description: Tool speed multipliers extracted from items.json
files: tool_speeds.json - Full tool speeds for all tools and block types
tool_speeds_simplified.json - Simplified lookup table (material -> tool_type -> speed)
tool_speeds.usage: Tool speeds determine how fast tools break blocks. Used with block hardness to calculate break time.
tool_speeds.note: Speeds: wooden=2, stone=4, copper=5, iron=6, diamond=8, netherite=9, golden=12. Hand=1.0 (no tool).

block_hardness.description: Block hardness values extracted from Breaking documentation
files: block_hardness.json - Hardness values for all blocks (hardness determines break time)
block_hardness.source: docs/protocol/Breaking â€“ Minecraft Wiki.html (parsed from HTML table using BeautifulSoup)
block_hardness.usage: Hardness values are used to calculate break time. Combined with tool speeds to determine actual break time.
block_hardness.note: Hardness values: -1 = unbreakable (infinite), 0.5 = soft (dirt/sand), 1.5 = stone, 50.0 = obsidian, etc.

files: registries.json - Full registry data with protocol IDs
blocks.json - Full block data with state IDs
items.json - Full item data with protocol IDs

usage_in_server.loot_tables: Used in load_loot_tables() to determine item drops from broken blocks
usage_in_server.biomes: Used in get_registry_entries() for minecraft:worldgen/biome registry
usage_in_server.damage_types: Used in get_registry_entries() for minecraft:damage_type registry
usage_in_server.block_tags: Used for block breaking logic - mineable tags indicate which tools can mine which blocks efficiently
usage_in_server.tool_speeds: Used to calculate break time for block breaking animations - tool speed multipliers for different materials
usage_in_server.block_hardness: Used to calculate break time for block breaking animations - determines base hardness of each block
usage_in_server.registries: Used throughout server for protocol ID lookups (items, entities, etc.)
usage_in_server.blocks: Used for block state ID to block name mappings
